title: Welcome to the Fonij Blog
excerpt: An introduction to the Fonij React template blog system and how it works.
content:
This is your first demo post in the Fonij blog.

You can edit or delete this post from the Blog CMS page (/admin/blog).

The blog feature is fully client-side and uses localStorage by default, so you can prototype quickly without a backend.

title: Building a Simple Blog CMS Without a Backend
excerpt: How to build a localStorage-powered CMS in a Vite + React project.
content:
In this demo post, we show how you can manage blog posts entirely on the client side.

Posts are stored in localStorage, which is great for templates, prototypes, and small projects.

Later, you can swap the storage layer with a real API (Supabase, Django, etc.) without changing the UI components.

title: Draft Post Example (Hidden from Public)
excerpt: This post is a draft and will not appear on the public blog list.
content:
Draft posts are useful when you want to prepare content before publishing.

The CMS screen shows both published posts and drafts.

The public /blog page only shows posts with status 'published'.
